title: Engineering Management | Duke Engineering Master's Programs
raw_text:
Master of Engineering Management
The Master’s degree
of choice for engineers wanting to grow their careers, by gaining essential business and leadership skills while continuing to expand their technical expertise.  It's interdisciplinary and flexible, application focused, current and relevant—and comes with Duke's best-in-class graduate student experience.
Campus Study
Online Study

How to Apply
Master of Engineering Management
The Master’s degree
of choice for engineers wanting to grow their careers, by gaining essential business and leadership skills while continuing to expand their technical expertise.  It’s interdisciplinary and flexible, application focused, current and relevant—and comes with Duke’s best-in-class graduate student experience.
Campus Study
Online Study
1 Year
to complete on campus, or 2 years online
4 Electives
choose from among hundreds of Duke technical courses
#5
Online Engineering Management Program
US News & World Report 2025
86%
of our grads actively pursuing employment found jobs within 6 months of graduation
Become a Business-Savvy Engineering Leader
Having a technical background and business skills is a combination with significant advantages.
There’s a critical need across the globe for leaders who can solve complex problems by integrating technical skill, business acumen, and soft skills. Duke’s Master of Engineering Management graduates fill that need.
An Ideal Degree Program For Applicants Who…
Are interested in advancing in engineering-oriented careers (e.g. product-focused, operations, entrepreneurship, among many others)
Value how core business and soft skills differentiate engineers and position them for leadership
Appreciate the value of an applied, AI-relevant curriculum geared toward industry and career readiness
Are focused on an executive career
Request Information
Our Learning Culture
Professionalism and the 5 Principles
Together these create a core competency and a shared view, which faculty and staff deliver through a common student experience.
Learn more
A National Leader
Duke is a founding member of the Master of Engineering Management Programs Consortium—a group of highly recognized graduate-level programs.
Learn more
No Time for a Degree?
Check our our 100% online, four-course graduate certificate for working professionals.
See details
Join Our Mailing List
Attend an Online Event
Contact Admissions
News
More news
9/19
Pratt School of Engineering
How GSPS Shapes Student Life at Duke Engineering
The Graduate Student Programs & Services team provides a uniquely embedded support system that empowers master’s and PhD students from around the globe to thrive academically, professionally and personally.
8/22
Pratt School of Engineering
Duke’s Design Defense Studio Trains Troops to Think Like Professional Innovators
Intensive program gives service members the tools to pitch, prototype and scale defense innovations that address real battlefield needs while earning credit toward a graduate engineering certificate or master’s degree.
7/2
Duke Today
Gen. Charles Q. Brown Jr. to be Executive-in-Residence at Duke
Former Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff will engage with students and faculty through Duke Engineering’s Character Forward program.
